intro: Herrania nitida var. sphenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leafed Herrania, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a shrub characterized by its slender, often branched stems and narrow, elliptical leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually white or pale yellow, which bloom in summer. Its leaves are aromatic and have a slightly bitter taste, making it useful in traditional medicine. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, preferring well-drained soils and partial shade.
